meanings.definition: Cook (food) for too long or at too high a temperature.
meanings.sent1: She always overcooks the pasta, making it mushy and tasteless.
meanings.sent2: If you overcook the steak, it will become tough and dry.
meanings.sent3: He overcooks the vegetables every time, turning them into a sad, soggy mess.
meanings.sent4: The chef overcooks the chicken until it resembles shoe leather.
meanings.sent5: The smell of burnt toast filled the kitchen as she overcooks it yet again.

meanings.sent1: My mom always overcooks the rice, making it sticky and clumpy.
meanings.sent2: If you overcook the eggs, they will turn rubbery and unappetizing.
meanings.sent3: She overcooks the cookies until they are as hard as rocks.
meanings.sent4: The chef overcooks the soup until it becomes a thick, unpalatable sludge.
meanings.sent5: The smell of burnt popcorn wafted from the microwave as she overcooks it once more.

meanings.sent1: She overcooks the soup on the stove, forgetting about it until it boils over.
meanings.sent2: If you overcook the vegetables, they will lose their nutrients.
meanings.sent3: He overcooks the hot chocolate, turning it into a bitter, burnt mess.
meanings.sent4: The chef overcooks the sauce, resulting in a charred, inedible disaster.
meanings.sent5: The smell of overcooked popcorn lingered in the air, making everyone cough.
